action.action-desc: Mr. Ryan of Ohio (for himself and Mr. Gonzalez of Ohio) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources
Reported with an amendment, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed

form.official-title: To amend the National Trails System Act to direct the Secretary of the Interior to conduct a study on the feasibility of designating the Buckeye Trail as a national scenic trail, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Buckeye National Scenic Trail Feasibility Study Act of 2021.

section.header: Buckeye National Scenic Trail Feasibility Study
section.text: Section 5(c) of the National Trails System Act (16 U.S.C. 1244(c)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: The Buckeye Trail, a system of trails creating a loop extending approximately 1,454 miles from Lake Erie to the Ohio River, through the farmland of northwest Ohio, the hills of Appalachia, the Black Hand sandstone cliffs of the Hocking Hills region, and the Bluegrass region of southwest Ohio.

bill.official-title-amendment: Amend the title so as to read: A bill to amend the National Trails System Act to authorize a study on the feasibility of designating the Buckeye Trail as a national scenic trail, and for other purposes..
